newsitem.title: USA: USWC light crudes fall, talk thin ahead of weekend.
newsitem.headline: USWC light crudes fall, talk thin ahead of weekend.

text.p: U.S. West Coast light crudes fell on weaker West Texas Intermediate values, with few prospects of a deal ahead of the weekend.
October WTI was burdened by weaker product futures and fell about twenty cents from Thursday. The September/October roll widened from 20 to 40 cents in afternoon trade.
That left October WTI at $22.00/22.10 a barrel.
Buyers had ample crude for September and began to focus on purchasing October cargoes, though a major refiner was said to seek offers.
Early Thursday, the dominant ANS producer sold to a Hawaiian refiner at $2.05 a barrel under October WTI, 10 cents lower than the previous sale.
Atlantic Richfield Co denied market rumors from late Thursday and early today that its Ferndale, Washington, refinery had an outage.
"We haven't had any operational problems," a spokesman said.
Prices for Line 63 slipped with WTI, but spot deals off WTI remained dormant.
Arco on Wednesday limited crude oil shipments on Line 63 to 46.81 percent of nominations for September.
Kern River and Wilmington grades were unchanged late.
